maintext:
Northeast Ohio school closings and delays for Wednesday, Jan. 3, 2018
CLEVELAND, Ohio — It’s another cold start for Northeast Ohio, with temperatures in the single digits and wind chills around minus-11 degrees.
The extreme cold is leading to another round of school closings and delays in the area. Ashtabula City Schools and Cleveland Central Catholic High School are closed today, while many other districts are putting off the start of classes in hopes temperatures will be more tolerable as the day progresses.
Highs hitting 20s (finally): Weather forecast
There is a chance temperatures could get above 20 degrees today, but steady winds will make it feel much colder. No snow is expected this morning but there could be snow showers later in the afternoon and tonight.
Below is a list of school closings and delays for Wednesday. For a list that includes trade schools and churches, go to WKYC Channel 3 or WEWS Channel 5.
Districts on the list have canceled classes for Wednesday unless otherwise noted:
